values.description:
The usual fixes for MSVC12.

Note for future developments: please, place the visibility macro into its own header file, not shared with any code. It took me a while to discover the origin of the weird failures this time.

Testing run: http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/23/console

Let's fix the unstable status in a different pull request.
values.title: Fix windows build

values.description:
This enables to "parse" the `CMakeLists.txt` file and extract the project name. Relying on variable expansion would make this way more complicated.

It also restores the meaning of `PROJECT_NAME` to contain the project name and uses a custom variable `PROJECT_NAME_WITH_VERSION` instead.
values.title: pass string literal to project() to make the project name parsable

summary.raw:
This enables to "parse" the `CMakeLists.txt` file and extract the project name. Relying on variable expansion would make this way more complicated.

It also restores the meaning of `PROJECT_NAME` to contain the project name and uses a custom variable `PROJECT_NAME_WITH_VERSION` instead.
summary.html:
This enables to "parse" the CMakeLists.txt file and extract the project name. Relying on variable expansion would make this way more complicated.

It also restores the meaning of PROJECT_NAME to contain the project name and uses a custom variable PROJECT_NAME_WITH_VERSION instead.

values.description:
On Windows, the configure.bat-based build process passes
all the ignition-math variables directly to the CMake call.
However also the classical find_package(ignition-math2)
works perfectly on Windows, if ign-math2 has been installed
to a default directory or if its installation directory has been
added to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or ignition-math2_DIR . This commit
adds support for using ignition-math2 as a "normal" cmake
package, retaining support for the configure.bat-based build process.
values.title: Fix find_package(ignition-math2) on Windows

summary.raw:
On Windows, the configure.bat-based build process passes
all the ignition-math variables directly to the CMake call.
However also the classical find_package(ignition-math2)
works perfectly on Windows, if ign-math2 has been installed
to a default directory or if its installation directory has been
added to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or ignition-math2_DIR . This commit
adds support for using ignition-math2 as a "normal" cmake
package, retaining support for the configure.bat-based build process.
summary.html: On Windows, the configure.bat-based build process passes all the ignition-math variables directly to the CMake call. However also the classical find_package(ignition-math2) works perfectly on Windows, if ign-math2 has been installed to a default directory or if its installation directory has been added to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or ignition-math2_DIR . This commit adds support for using ignition-math2 as a "normal" cmake package, retaining support for the configure.bat-based build process.

values.description:
On Windows, the configure.bat-based build process passes all the ignition-math variables directly to the CMake call. However also the classical find_package(ignition-math2) works perfectly on Windows, if ign-math2 has been installed to a default directory or if its installation directory has been added to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or ignition-math2_DIR . This commit adds support for using ignition-math2 as a "normal" cmake package, retaining support for the configure.bat-based build process.

Remake of #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/20/fix-find_package-ignition-math2-on-windows/diff that just copies logic from the `sdformat` repo.
values.title: Copy find ign-math2 cmake logic from sdformat

This commit adds support for using ignition-math2 as a "normal" cmake package, retaining support for the configure.bat-based build process.

summary.html:
On Windows, the configure.bat-based build process passes all the ignition-math variables directly to the CMake call. However also the classical find_package(ignition-math2) works perfectly on Windows, if ign-math2 has been installed to a default directory or if its installation directory has been added to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or ignition-math2_DIR . This commit adds support for using ignition-math2 as a "normal" cmake package, retaining support for the configure.bat-based build process.

values.description:
Resolves issue #9.

This is the command I ran:

`for file in $( find . -name "*.proto" ); do cat ~/header.txt ${file} > ${file}.tmp; mv ${file}.tmp ${file}; done`

where `~/.header.txt` contained the copyright header.
values.title: Adds copyright information to proto files.

summary.raw:
Resolves issue #9.

This is the command I ran:

`for file in $( find . -name "*.proto" ); do cat ~/header.txt ${file} > ${file}.tmp; mv ${file}.tmp ${file}; done`

where `~/.header.txt` contained the copyright header.
summary.html:
Resolves issue #9.

This is the command I ran:

for file in $( find . -name "*.proto" ); do cat ~/header.txt ${file} > ${file}.tmp; mv ${file}.tmp ${file}; done

where ~/.header.txt contained the copyright header.

values.description:
This CMake variable might be useful for creating custom Protobuf messages that use some of the Ignition Msgs. `IGN-MSGS_PROTO_PATH` will be used when invoking `protoc`.

Motivated by the conversation in [this pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/219/new-example-using-custom-protobuf-messages/diff).
values.title: Add IGN-MSGS_PROTO_PATH to config.cmake

See issue #13

summary.raw:
* Removed all `*_stamped` messages in favor of using normal messages with header
* Removed `time` and `stamp` fields from messages which appeared to be fulfilling this purpose (but it's hard to be sure since most messages are not documented)

See issue #13
summary.html:
• Removed all *_stamped messages in favor of using normal messages with header
  • Removed time and stamp fields from messages which appeared to be fulfilling this purpose (but it's hard to be sure since most messages are not documented)

See issue #13

values.description:
On homebrew, the ignition-math4 formula now uses ignition-cmake, which defines some of the same macros as are used in other ignition packages. This [breaks the build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/55, as in [ign-common issue 25](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/issues/25/cmake-configuration-error-on-homebrew). There is a quick hack that involves re-loading the Utils.cmake file after all the find_package calls, as was done in the following PR:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/78

I also copied the appveyor scripts without ign-cmake from pull request #40.

The Ubuntu build also requires the following release-tools pull request:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/461/use-ignition-math4-for-ignition-msgs-on/diff
values.title: Hack to reload macros (similar to ign-common fix)

summary.raw:
On homebrew, the ignition-math4 formula now uses ignition-cmake, which defines some of the same macros as are used in other ignition packages. This [breaks the build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/55, as in [ign-common issue 25](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/issues/25/cmake-configuration-error-on-homebrew). There is a quick hack that involves re-loading the Utils.cmake file after all the find_package calls, as was done in the following PR:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/78

I also copied the appveyor scripts without ign-cmake from pull request #40.

The Ubuntu build also requires the following release-tools pull request:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/461/use-ignition-math4-for-ignition-msgs-on/diff
summary.html:
On homebrew, the ignition-math4 formula now uses ignition-cmake, which defines some of the same macros as are used in other ignition packages. This [breaks the build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/55, as in ign-common issue 25. There is a quick hack that involves re-loading the Utils.cmake file after all the find_package calls, as was done in the following PR:

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/78

I also copied the appveyor scripts without ign-cmake from pull request #40.

The Ubuntu build also requires the following release-tools pull request:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/461/use-ignition-math4-for-ignition-msgs-on/diff

summary.html: This is to ensure that projects still relying on ign-math3 are still compatible with this project.

values.description:
Proposal of a message to define motion constraints based on [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/38/support-camera-tracking-and-following) ign-rendering pull request. Initially, the message would be used to define how a camera will track an entity in the world, but I tried to keep the message general enough so it may apply to other entities besides cameras. 

I thought it made more sense to start a new message than trying to adapt the existing [track_visual](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/src/dae89a2405bbde1b6e9b8cb082b50b01c03cc22a/ignition/msgs/track_visual.proto?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) message. In fact, I think if this one is accepted, we should deprecate that one.
values.title: Motion constraint message

summary.raw:
Proposal of a message to define motion constraints based on [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/38/support-camera-tracking-and-following) ign-rendering pull request. Initially, the message would be used to define how a camera will track an entity in the world, but I tried to keep the message general enough so it may apply to other entities besides cameras. 

I thought it made more sense to start a new message than trying to adapt the existing [track_visual](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/src/dae89a2405bbde1b6e9b8cb082b50b01c03cc22a/ignition/msgs/track_visual.proto?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) message. In fact, I think if this one is accepted, we should deprecate that one.
summary.html:
Proposal of a message to define motion constraints based on this ign-rendering pull request. Initially, the message would be used to define how a camera will track an entity in the world, but I tried to keep the message general enough so it may apply to other entities besides cameras.

I thought it made more sense to start a new message than trying to adapt the existing track_visual message. In fact, I think if this one is accepted, we should deprecate that one.

values.reason: GUI and rendering will not use transport between them for now

values.description:
This moves the `*.proto` message description files into a `proto` subdirectory which is symmetrical to the `include` subdirectory that headers are located in. This should make the filesystem less confusing to navigate.

The diff is enormous, but almost all of the changes are simply moving files. The only changes which aren't a simple file move are [a couple lines in `src/CMakeLists.txt`](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/45/move-proto-files-into-a-more-explicit/diff#chg-src/CMakeLists.txt).

~~To avoid creating a diff which is impossible to review, we should wait to merge this until pull request #40 is merged, then we should retarget this PR to the `default` branch.~~ This is ready for merging.
values.title: Move proto files into a more explicit subdirectory

summary.raw:
This moves the `*.proto` message description files into a `proto` subdirectory which is symmetrical to the `include` subdirectory that headers are located in. This should make the filesystem less confusing to navigate.

The diff is enormous, but almost all of the changes are simply moving files. The only changes which aren't a simple file move are [a couple lines in `src/CMakeLists.txt`](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/45/move-proto-files-into-a-more-explicit/diff#chg-src/CMakeLists.txt).

~~To avoid creating a diff which is impossible to review, we should wait to merge this until pull request #40 is merged, then we should retarget this PR to the `default` branch.~~ This is ready for merging.
summary.html:
This moves the *.proto message description files into a proto subdirectory which is symmetrical to the include subdirectory that headers are located in. This should make the filesystem less confusing to navigate.

The diff is enormous, but almost all of the changes are simply moving files. The only changes which aren't a simple file move are a couple lines in src/CMakeLists.txt.

To avoid creating a diff which is impossible to review, we should wait to merge this until pull request #40 is merged, then we should retarget this PR to the default branch. This is ready for merging.

values.title: More elegant, forward-compatible installation of proto files

summary.raw: This is based on the recommendations made [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/commits/776d976c0ed0af586aac7f2af72d366d6912dff4#comment-5522786).
summary.html: This is based on the recommendations made here.

values.description:
I ran into a funny problem while working on the [ign-cmake Components pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/2/).

I vaguely recall during the early phase of the adoption of ign-cmake, I had accidentally moved the master header to be located in `ignition/project/project.hh` instead of `ignition/project.hh`. @caguero caught this and informed me about it, so I fixed the `install` command to install the master header back to `ignition/project.hh`.

However, it seems that the file was still getting *configured* to `include/ignition/project/project.hh` even though it's been getting installed to the correct location. It seems that at some point, `ign-msgs` was changed to accommodate this, so `ign.cc` has been using `#include "ignition/msgs/msgs.hh"`.

Here's where things get even funnier: The Components branch of `ign-cmake` was already fixed months ago to configure the master header to the correct location, even though the current `default` branch has been configuring to the wrong location. Because of this, `ign-msgs` fails to build against the Components branch of `ign-cmake`, since it can't find the file `ignition/msgs/msgs.hh` as it should actually be getting configured as `ignition/msgs.hh`.

This pull request sidesteps the issue entirely by just not using the master header. Merging this PR before we merge the [Components PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/2/) should help out the CI.

Note that none of this has any effect on end-users, because the master header has been getting *installed* to the correct location; it just hasn't been getting *configured* to the correct location inside of the build folder.
values.title: Avoid using the master include header

However, it seems that the file was still getting *configured* to `include/ignition/project/project.hh` even though it's been getting installed to the correct location. It seems that at some point, `ign-msgs` was changed to accommodate this, so `ign.cc` has been using `#include "ignition/msgs/msgs.hh"`.

Here's where things get even funnier: The Components branch of `ign-cmake` was already fixed months ago to configure the master header to the correct location, even though the current `default` branch has been configuring to the wrong location. Because of this, `ign-msgs` fails to build against the Components branch of `ign-cmake`, since it can't find the file `ignition/msgs/msgs.hh` as it should actually be getting configured as `ignition/msgs.hh`.

summary.html:
I ran into a funny problem while working on the ign-cmake Components pull request.

I vaguely recall during the early phase of the adoption of ign-cmake, I had accidentally moved the master header to be located in ignition/project/project.hh instead of ignition/project.hh. @caguero caught this and informed me about it, so I fixed the install command to install the master header back to ignition/project.hh.

However, it seems that the file was still getting configured to include/ignition/project/project.hh even though it's been getting installed to the correct location. It seems that at some point, ign-msgs was changed to accommodate this, so ign.cc has been using #include "ignition/msgs/msgs.hh".

Here's where things get even funnier: The Components branch of ign-cmake was already fixed months ago to configure the master header to the correct location, even though the current default branch has been configuring to the wrong location. Because of this, ign-msgs fails to build against the Components branch of ign-cmake, since it can't find the file ignition/msgs/msgs.hh as it should actually be getting configured as ignition/msgs.hh.

This pull request sidesteps the issue entirely by just not using the master header. Merging this PR before we merge the Components PR should help out the CI.

Note that none of this has any effect on end-users, because the master header has been getting installed to the correct location; it just hasn't been getting configured to the correct location inside of the build folder.

values.description: These changes were introduced to the release branch `ign-msgs1` and now should be merged forward onto `default`.
values.title: Merge forward to default from ign-msgs1
